author: 新闻中心 编辑：鲍苗苗 责任编辑：叶双莲 监制：张佳玮
title: 持续增厚"绿色家底" 温州去年森林覆盖率增速全省第二-新闻中心-温州网
text:
持续增厚“绿色家底” 温州去年森林覆盖率增速全省第二
温州网讯 草木蔓发，春山可望。3月12日是第47个植树节，温州多地推出植树节活动，市民一同参与植绿、护绿，成为“绿色合伙人”。昨日，记者从市自然资源和规划局获悉，在坚持不懈植树造林下，我市林业工作“增绿增质增效”，目前，温州市森林面积1066.13万亩，覆盖率达58.73%，2024年森林覆盖率增速位居全省第二，市自然资源和规划局入选全国绿化行业最高荣誉全国绿化模范单位表彰名单。
近年来，温州全面推行林长制1+7制度体系，在全省率先出台青年林长制度，释放社会参与护林新动能。此外，我市还聚焦资源挖潜，激活森林发展新引擎，开展新增百万亩国土绿化、千万亩森林质量精准提升、“一村万树”等一批重大生态建设工程，新增绿化面积居全省前列。2024年，全市共落实造林绿化面积3.06万亩，完成率142.33%；完成千万亩森林质量精准提升工程4.12万亩，完成率126%；文成县入选全省7个松林林相改造省级试点；泰顺县入选全省5个中央投资“双重”项目，总投资超6800万元，创我市林业中央投资新高。
温州以绿色发展为导向,向“绿”而行,点“绿”成金,拓展富民强村新路径。去年，通过发展森林康养和林下经济等林业主导产业，我市林业总产值同比增长10.3%，增速全省第二。此外，我市不断拓宽森林资源利用和价值转化通道，林业股份合作制改革、林权流转机制改革、林业金融改革、国有林场改革等工作取得显著成效，入选第三批省级林业共同富裕综合体试点达到3个，数量全省最多；省级和国家级森林康养基地数量也居全省前列，并成功入选国家级全域森林康养试点建设市。
今年2月，我市获得由《湿地公约》认证的“国际湿地城市”称号，全国仅有9个城市，并代表全国唯一一个滨海湿地城市类型被国家林草局列为全国5个湿地总量管控制度研究试点城市之一。温州城市生态系统国家定位观测研究站顺利落地，系浙江省除杭州之外又一个国家级城市生态观测站。
我市积极探索生态补偿新路径，建成全国首个林业共富碳汇应用项目，在全国率先发布林业共富碳汇计量方法学；还印发了林业碳汇中长期规划，完成3个省级林业碳汇试点建设任务，致力打造全国林业碳汇先行示范市。目前瑞安市开发全国首批CCER造林碳汇4万亩，20年计入期碳汇预估价值超4000万元。
来源：温州日报
原标题：持续增厚“绿色家底”
我市去年森林覆盖率增速全省第二
记者：林迎颖
本文转自：温州新闻网 66wz.com

author: VNExplorer
title: The Seven Last Words of Jesus Christ: A Gen Z’s take
text:
The Seven Last Words of Jesus Christ: A Gen Z’s take
CEBU CITY, Philippines – The season of Lent, which includes the Holy Week, may be our chance to rediscover our faith in our Lord.
As someone who has been raised in a not-so-strict Catholic family, I admit that there are instances in which I sometimes lose my footing when it comes to my faith and religion.
But as I grew old, activities that often bring back life and excitement doesn’t work out as they did back in the day.
Holy Week traditions: What is Visita Iglesia?
Holy Week 2024: Understanding the Sacred Triduum
I felt weak and tired as if I were floating around with no one to ground me in reality.
Feeling embarrassed, I quietly looked back to our Lord and, as expected, he was there, smiling proudly for his child has returned.
Unfolding Jesus’ Seven Last Words As the Holy Week unfolds, Christians worldwide turn their hearts and minds to the final moments of Jesus Christ on the cross.
Reflecting on the Seven Last Words Jesus spoke in this Holy season offers profound insights and spiritual nourishment.
As a 24-year-old young adult navigating the complexities of life in the modern world, these Words uniquely resonate with me, offering guidance, comfort, and hope.
Let’s delve into the powerful Seven Last Words from the perspective of a young Cebuana Gen Z seeking meaning and purpose in today’s society.
1. “Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do.” (Luke 23:34) In a world often filled with judgment and condemnation, these words remind us of the transformative power of forgiveness.
As a young adult, I admit I encounter situations where forgiveness can feel daunting or impossible.
Even though it’s hard, Jesus’ example inspires me to show kindness even when hurt or betrayed, acknowledging the humanity and capacity for change in others.
2. “Truly, I say to you, today you will be with me in paradise.” (Luke 23:43) Amidst suffering and despair, Jesus promises redemption and eternal life.
In a world where material wealth and instant satisfaction are often valued, and even I admit that I am often caught with these nasty webs. These words remind me of the lasting importance of faith and spiritual contentment.
They offer solace in times of uncertainty and point towards hope beyond the challenges of the present moment.
3. “Woman, behold your son. Behold your mother.” (John 19:26-27) Jesus demonstrates care and compassion for those closest to Him, even in His final moments.
This act of entrusting His mother to the care of His beloved disciple speaks to the importance of community and support in times of trial.
As a young adult finding my way, I’m reminded of the importance of nurturing relationships and the support found in close bonds of love and solidarity.
Though not blood-related, these connections feel like family, offering support through both good times and bad.
4. “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?” (Matthew 27:46) These words express the depths of human anguish and despair, echoing the cries of those who feel abandoned or alone.
As a young person grappling with existential questions and the challenges of modern life, I find solace in the knowledge that even Jesus experienced moments of profound doubt and isolation.
His vulnerability invites me to bring my struggles before a loving, compassionate God who understands my pain.
5. “I thirst.” (John 19:28) Jesus acknowledges His humanity and shares His experiences of suffering in His physical thirst.
These words serve as a reminder of the importance of empathy and solidarity with those who thirst for justice, compassion, and necessities.
As a young adult passionate about social justice and global solidarity, Jesus’ cry speaks to my desire to alleviate the suffering of others and work towards a more equitable world.
6. “It is finished.” (John 19:30) With these words, Jesus declares that He has finished His mission on Earth and fulfilled God’s plan for salvation.
As someone still navigating the uncertainties of adulthood, I find reassurance in knowing that even in moments of apparent defeat or failure, purpose and meaning exist to be found.
Jesus’ declaration reminds me to trust the bigger picture and to remain steadfast in my faith, knowing that God will ultimately fulfill His promises.
7. “Father, into your hands I commend my spirit.” (Luke 23:46) In his final breath, Jesus fully surrenders Himself to God’s will, trusting in divine providence and the promise of resurrection.
As a young adult striving to surrender control and embrace trust in God’s plan, these words inspire me to relinquish my fears and anxieties, placing my life and future in God’s loving hands.
As we journey through Holy Week and meditate on the Seven Last Words of Jesus, let us, as young adults, embrace the timeless wisdom and profound love contained within these utterances.
Even though you may find yourself submerged in moments of doubt, temptation, and even godlessness, remember that the Lord will always be there, ready to take you back into His arms.

author: Angel Saunders
title: Former Pro Baseball Player Drowns After Jumping in Water to Save Swimmers Caught in Current
text:
“He died trying to save others," the Pawleys Island Police Department said
By Angel Saunders Angel Saunders Angel Saunders has been a writer at PEOPLE since 2023. She’s previously worked at iHeartMedia, IndieWire, and REVOLT. People Editorial Guidelines Published on July 17, 2025 12:57AM EDT 1 Comment Chase Childers. Credit : gofundme
NEED TO KNOW Chase Childers drowned on Sunday, July 13, while trying to rescue swimmers in distress The incident happened on South Carolina’s Pawleys Island The husband and father of three was a former professional baseball player who spent time in the Baltimore Orioles' farm system A former professional baseball player drowned while attempting to rescue swimmers in distress in South Carolina, police said.
On Tuesday, July 15, the Pawleys Island Police Department identified 38-year-old Chase Childers as the victim of a Sunday, July 13, incident that occurred while the husband and father of three was vacationing.
“We would like to provide additional information on Sunday's incident," the PIPD said via X . "The victim, Chase Childers, and another person entered the water to help 4-5 individuals who were in distress. Sadly, Mr. Childers was caught in the rip current, as well. He died trying to save others.”
Chase Childers. gofundme
The Georgetown County Sheriff's Office said on Sunday that their deputies “participated in the recovery of a body from the ocean today after a swimmer in distress was reported just after 5 p.m.”
Bystanders were unsuccessful in their efforts to save him before first responders arrived.
Childers was a former professional baseball player, spending 2009 and 2010 in the Baltimore Orioles farm system. After retiring from the sport, he worked as a Cobb County police officer and received a lifetime achievement award for saving lives, per a GoFundMe established to help his family.
"We are devastated by the tragic loss of our beloved Chase," GoFundMe organizer Jordan Wicker said. "It feels surreal, incredibly hard to grasp, and profoundly unfair.”
The post contained a photo of Childers standing outdoors for a professional family photoshoot.
“Chase was a truly selfless individual, always prioritizing the safety of others above his own," his family said in a statement to WCDB . "Without hesitation, he would leap into action whenever someone was in need, ready to tackle any challenge that came his way. To his family and all who knew him, he will forever be remembered as a hero.”
Chase Childers. gofundme
Law enforcement officials said this has been the fifth drowning on Pawleys Island since June 2023 and the second in the past month, the news station reported.
“The Town is saddened by the report of the drowning over the weekend. We pray for the family members and offer our condolences," Pawleys Island Mayor Brian Henry said in a statement on Monday, July 14.
Henry also thanked the local first responders “who worked tirelessly to recover the victim and bring comfort to the family.”
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
The mayor urged residents and visitors to use caution when entering the water, “particularly during high surf,” and asked for everyone’s help in keeping Pawleys Island one of “the safest” beaches on the East Coast.
“We regret the recent drownings and Town Council will investigate all means available to mitigate the risk of future occurrences, including efforts to educate visitors on the dangers of rip currents,” the mayor concluded.
Childers is survived by his wife, Nataley, who had been his soulmate and best friend since they were teenagers, as well as their three children.
Close Leave a Comment
